reviews.text: This hotel has great location in the Latin Quarter and we feel it was a good value for the money. The staff was also very helpful when my daughter became ill in the middle of the night. They summoned a doctor who reached the hotel in 30 minutes.
reviews.title: Good Value, Good Service

reviews.text: Its very easy to reach from Charles D. G airport with the REF station a half-block away. There are restaurants and grocery stores on the same block and the Luxumborg Garden is on the next block. We had an updated room facing an inside court yard. The bathroom looked like it had just been remodeled.
reviews.title: Nothing special, needs renovations

reviews.text: The location was good and there was air conditioning but the hotel is tired. Rooms could use a paint job and detailing. Bathroom was clean but shower is an open stall with just a curtain so water gets everywhere. For the most part it was quiet at night, but you do hear the underground trains running.
reviews.title: Very comforable

reviews.text: Travelling on my own on a "round the world trip", stayed at the Hotel des Mines in Paris from April 21 for four nights. The location was great, within walking distance of Notre Dame, and was surrounded by a number of very nice brassieries. A Metro railway station was within walking distance also.The room (I'd booked a single) was a bit small, but very clean with a comfortable bed, and the bathroom was a good size - excellent. The service was very good. The reception staff were helpful and WILLING TO SPEAK ENGLISH! A pleasant continental breakfast was available for 8 euros, although I went out a couple of the days.
reviews.title: Pleasant two stars hotel located on Boulevard de Saint Michel

reviews.title: Central and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second visit to Paris this year. I previously stayed at Des Grandes Hotel, with no complaints (see review) but was looking for more reasonably priced accommodation this time.
reviews.title: Good value hotel
Great Price, great location, clean and cozy
reviews.text: On reflection, I'm not sure I made the right choice.

Hotel Des Mines was perfectly adequate - small, but clean, rooms. I did not have breakfast - my husband did twice and thought it was good value. The hotel is central near the RER and the staff are professional. My problem was the location - Blvd St. Michel. It is central, but too crowded by day and empty by 9.30 p.m.
reviews.title: great place to stay in paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Des Grandes Ecoles is on the door step of Rue Mouffetard - a bustling area that seems like the "real" Paris or what I imagined Paris to be like. In contrast the Bvld. St. Michel was like any big street in any big city. Rue Mouffetard is not far from Hotel des Mines - 15 /20 minutes walk, but the atmosphere is totally different.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If it's your first visit to Paris, I would not stay here, you need to soak up the atmosphere which, in my view, can't be done on the Bvld. St. Michel. However if you just need a good budget hotel in a safe area it's fine. The difference in price is € 130 per night Des Grandes and € 84 per night Des Mines.
reviews.title: Great for amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there with my husband and the location can't be better. The boulevard San Martin is a wonderful street to go walking, full of people and good cafés, restaurants and shops.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very close to the metro Luxembourg, and to the Luxembourg Garden. You can go walking until the Notre Dame Church. There is a small market nearby, a fruit store and a cheap internet too. On the way to Notre Dame, close to the hotel, there's the best crepe we found at the city.
reviews.title: Very Good Value

reviews.text: We choosed to take the breakfast that is very nice, with fruits, cereals, breads, juices, milk (with coffee or chocolate).
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff speaks english, and it´s ok. Not so friendly, nor rude.
reviews.title: Good value, great location

reviews.text: The room is very small, as almost all Paris hotels, but clean and quite confortable. However for those who are very big, the shower is small. But the bathroom is very clean and brand new.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel, read this review..

likes.liked: — Value for money, friendly staff, closeness to Metro and restaurants!
likes.disliked: — The view outside the window. That's it, Hotel Des Mines was great!

reviews.text: Everything about this hotel is acceptable. The room was clean and spacious enough by Parisian standards. The staff I encountered were pleasant. The shower worked well and with hot water - some times a problem in Paris. I didn't have breakfast but like just about everywhere in Paris you'd be better going out to eat than forking out a considerable sum for a boring continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Decent enough for a night or two

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is also quite good in that it is only a 10 to 15 minute walk from the nightlife of Blvd Saint Germain and even closer to the Pantheon. Personally I prefer to be nearer to restaurants and bars than have to walk through an area where everything is closed after dark . For instance I had the unenviable choice of McDonald's or Quick burgers for a late night snack on my way back to the hotel as there was nothing else open in the area. But I suppose that's a small fault.
reviews.title: Nice place
Great for Paris
reviews.text: It is also close to the Luxembourg RER (train) station which is just a minute or so north of the hotel. The vibrations from the train were minimal - indeed barely noticeable in my room and I believe it stops shortly after midnight anyway. Nor was a I woken by it in the morning and I'm a light sleeper.

Hotel des Mines will not be my first choice in my next trip to Paris, entirely because of the neighbourhood. But I wouldn't hesitate to stay again if other plans fell through or I needed a hotel close to RER for an early morning departure.
reviews.title: A very nice budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for a week with my girlfriend. You can't beat the location at this price (especially with the off-season discount). The rooms are not huge and it isn't exactly opulent, but the place is clean and our bathroom was recently refinished and in perfect condition.
reviews.title: Charming little hotel in the downtown
